intro: Cynoglossum densum, commonly known as the denseleaf bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are densely covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are clustered in whorls along the stem, forming a distinctive bell-shaped appearance. Cynoglossum densum thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats.
